entries.content: Figure out the reasons why a deal *cannot* happen or why it's *not* going to work. Overcoming these obstacles moves you closer to winning.
entries.notes: Related to identifying and overcoming obstacles/objections.

entries.content: Identify the main, consistent reasons why prospects don't buy from you by reviewing past losses.
Start using your common objections at the beginning of meetings to disqualify prospects early.
entries.notes: Tactical application of addressing obstacles upfront.

entries.content: "Look, I'll be up front with you Mr Prospect. Can I tell you the three reasons why we're probably not going to work together?"
entries.notes: Example phrase for introducing common objections early.

entries.content: When you state common reasons for not working together upfront, the prospect will either agree (leading to disqualification) or argue why those reasons don't apply to them.
entries.notes: Outcome of addressing obstacles early; gets prospect to overcome objections for you.

entries.content: Your job as a salesperson is to disqualify people that cannot buy from you.
entries.notes: Underpins the strategy of addressing potential obstacles/disqualifiers early.
